results.description: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi. It spreads through contaminated food and water or through close contact with someone who's infected.
results.recommendation: Consult a doctor for proper diagnosis and antibiotic treatment. Stay hydrated and get plenty of rest.

results.description: Malaria is a serious disease caused by a parasite that is transmitted via the bite of infected mosquitoes. Symptoms usually appear within 10-15 days after the infective bite.
results.recommendation: Seek immediate medical attention. Malaria requires proper diagnosis and treatment with antimalarial medications.

results.description: Influenza (flu) is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses. It can cause mild to severe illness and can lead to hospitalization or death in severe cases.
results.recommendation: Rest, stay hydrated, and take over-the-counter fever reducers. Consult a doctor if symptoms are severe or you're in a high-risk group.
